I then check my receipt and immediately notice that he put in an order for a Hotcakes w/ sausage order, c'mon. .   You want to disrespect me and then mess up my order? I made it very clear and there really shouldn't have been any confusion, it wasn't at all busy in front either.   I had to tell another girl working who then gave me a refund back on my debit card, which is quite a hassle because now I've got to wait to retrieve the money the cashier made me lose out on.  In short, I simply don't feel welcomed by this location in the slightest anymore. I'm just shocked really, to top it all off the cashier didn't even manage to press the "ask me" button which displays whether or not the cashier requested it as fresh or not.   My advice: At the very least, you should give and receive mutual respect, especially as an employee.

The worse MC Donald's . IT'S DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY. I had to WAIT 10 min and no one took my order.  I asked them to clean my table 3 times and they never did. The manager is lost.   Doesn't have any idea what she's doing.
The manager is the worst cashier. Managers should be leading customer service examples for  their employees.
Coming here is only when I'm really hungry and have nothing left to think of to eat. They can be really stingy on the Mcflurry. Depending on the day the burgers and fries are okay.

Great location! Conveniently located off of I-5.   This place is relatively new, and I can tell they need better training.  The customer service is great, and the food items are also always good. BUT, they almost always seem to forget something. Today, they forgot my daughters juice box for her kids meal. Weeks ago they forgot her go-gurt. And everything before that I can't remember.   So needless to say, when you pick up your order from the drive thru, double check your bag.

The drive through will take you at least 20 min every time. Writing this review sitting in line. I stop at this one more than any other location because it's close to my house, not really enough of a reason to come anymore

The worst McDonald's I have ever been to in my whole entire life! I went thru the drive thru today and ordered 4 McChickens, a large fry and a hamburger happy meal. First off it took us 20 mins in the drive thru from the wait time to order our food and getting our food. (There was only 4 cars in front of us) then when we get our food, they forgot to put in the sweet and sour sauce that I specifically asked for. The large fries was not even filled to the top and the meat for the hamburger happy meal was so small I thought that they forgot the meat.. Never coming here again, nor would I ever recommend anyone else to come too.

I felt that this McDonald's deserved an update. They fixed the app issue and now accept the coupons, which I appreciate very much. They usually get my orders right, but once in a while, they'll make mistakes here and there, which would be great if they could work on that. But overall, it's a nice McDonald's to go to in the area, and I usually visit this location fairly often.
Slowest Mcdonalds ever. Its suppose to be fast food. I think the girl at register was new. On the plus side my order came out before the people in front of me. :)

It's Christmas morning and the staff are here on a holiday to serve hungry patrons.  I read many reviews here and have not had a similar negative experience.  On the contrary, I see a very clean and well kept restaurant.   The manager looked like he was taking extra care in cleaning even the trash can lid.  Surprising that the Manager would take the effort to do  the tiny details  that ultimately make the restaurant a welcoming place.  The appearance is much better than many McDonald's I have been to.   The employee behind the counter, Jacob,  was very competent.  Single handedly taking care of the entire front counter with efficiency and very courteous.   Impressive job being the boss of the front counter.    A big thank you to this crew for working on Christmas and still being friendly,  courteous, and efficient.

So-called "24-hour" drive through. We pulled up to the window around 3am and there is literally a sign by the drive through window saying "24 hour drive through! Open all night!" And the woman at the drive-through mic told us "sorry. We don't open again until 4am. Come back later" like what?! Are you serious? FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. Do not expect to come here for a late night meal! They are NOT 24-hours like they say!

This location is extremely slow. Idk why but every time i come here it takes forever! And thats inside and the drive thru, they both take forever. It seems like their whole staff is new. But on the bright side the food always seems to be fresh when i order.
Been to this location a few times and not once have they gotten the order right. It's worth a drive across town.

Rude service, bad customer service. Waited 10 minutes for a special made hamburger for my daughter. They forgot to make it. Really? To top it off manager was rude and offered nothing for my convenience. Called the 1-800 number they gave me and left a voice mail twice and I have to get a response. I don't think a supervisor even exist. To top it off there prices are higher than other local McDonald's. Stay away!!

Just got a sausage egg mcmuffin around 2pm just cause they started doing it all day. Well, it tasted like it had been sitting out... All day. The muffin was harder than the jolly rancher I used to get the taste out of my mouth.

Soda was about 3/4 of the way full, had me wait 10 minutes for 3 burgers because buns were frozen, 1 cheeseburger had no ketchup, no onions, and the bun was hard and completely inedible...will drive farther to the other one next time.
I usually think of this restaurant chain of being dirty, but this location is the opposite. Very clean, prompt service and modern decor. Bravo McDonald's.

In the handful of times visiting this location, not once has their shake machine worked.  I don't think they have one, or don't know how to use it.  12+ cars in line at 6:00pm, crew is slow as molasses. They can't get a single order right. Prices and tax don't ring up correctly, they overcharge customers. Staff are incompetent and customer service doesn't care. Don't waste your time or money, go somewhere else.

I go to this McDonald's regularly because they're just around the corner from my house. Service is generally very good.  Workers are for the most part friendly and seem well trained. Food is typical McDonald's.  Don't think I can tell one McDonald's food from another.  Stopped by there yesterday to get food to take home.  I ordered a Big Mac and asked for extra sauce for myself.  Sausage McMuffins for my wife.  When I got home I looked at my receipt which had fallen out of the bag in front of me and which I usually just toss.  I saw that they had charged me 37 cents for the extra sauce.  WHAT??!!  For just one dollop or squeeze of the sauce dispenser?  How CHINTZY can you get!!!  Is there gold mixed into your "special" sauce?  Does it take that much EXTRA EFFORT to make one additional squirt of sauce?  I mean C'MON!!!!  Thirty seven cents is nothing but just the idea of squeezing a few extra cents out of folks that regularly come into your restaurant is galling to me.  Had to drop one star because of this!

ELK GROVE - What was supposed to have been a happy meal at a McDonald's restaurant turned unhappy for a woman eating with a group of mentally disabled adults.  "They're people like we're people, so they shouldn't be discriminated against," said Constance Gastinell who works with developmentally disabled adults through programs that help integrate them into the community.  Gastinell sometimes takes some of the adults to a McDonald's on Elk Grove Boulevard for lunch, but the last time they were there she says the owner kicked them out. "He came in and he said, 'well you guys, you can't eat here, you have to leave.'"  She said the owner told her they couldn't stay because they were conducting 'business.'  "We weren't conducting business. We came into eat. We had no paperwork; we had money to buy," said Gastinell.  But McDonalds says there was no discrimination. In a statement issued to News10, Dennis and Vicki Caldwell, the local owners of the restaurant, said, This recent situation involved a food fight within their group, and disruption to our other guests.  The Caldwells added it wasn't the first time such an incident has occurred.  We have consistently attempted to work with these guests and accommodate their needs as best we can, their statement read.  Gastinell says there was no food fight and her group was well behaved.  "We went in to eat. We weren't disruptive," she said.  She feels they were told to leave because they were mentally disabled.  "I did feel as though they were targeting us, although he [the owner] says that he wasn't. Being kicked out, how else are you supposed to feel?" Gastinell said.  Soon after she was asked to leave, she rounded up her clients and left. She wants others to understand the stigma that surrounds people with disabilities.  "When you see them hurt, it hurts you. That's why it's personal," said Gastinell.  While Gastinell says she will continue to defend her clients, she no longer plans on going to the Elk Grove restaurant.  News10/KXTV  - Having a mentally disabled daughter, Kathryn (pictured), this story drove me out of my mind. People have no idea how hard it is, just to go out to a store or restaurant or anywhere. We get the stares and the looks, sometimes from children, more often from adults. We've all seen the group of four or five disabled folks being assisted by a health care worker, going around a store to get some things or sitting at your local restaurant, just wanting to be like everyone else. I wish Elk Grove were closer, I'd like to chat with their manager. I hope "big" McDonalds is paying attention to this particular franchise, as how individual restaurants and employees treat guests is a direct reflection of the organization as a whole.

McDonald's are no longer really kid friendly. The people here are rude. They don't have paper towels in the bathroom to dry hands. They never give you any ketchup unless you remember to ask, when they do give you napkins, they give you like 2 pcs. Ummmm... I have two kids. You really think 2 napkins are enough? They hide everything now. No napkins, no straws, no ketchup, no paper towels in the bathrooms? Really don't like going to mcdonalds unless I absolutely have no choice.

THE WORST MCDS EVER!!!!!! Do not go here! Spent 20 mins ordering 2 meals! The guy at the window had no idea what we were asking for. They had to get a girl to help him and she still didn't know how to place the order. Went up to pay after all the trouble and they didn't have the two meals we wanted. This location seriously needs to get some new employees or train your employees better! They told us they weren't serving a certain breakfast item after 11am, it was 11:02am!!! If I wasn't sitting in the drive thru for 20 mins maybe you could serve me what I asked for!

The food was cold, the restaurant looked like a bomb went off in it, it was 3:30 PM, so no rush hour excuse, I asked the counter person, Jean, if he or someone could wipe off my table, he said yes, but at 4:05 PM, no one got to it? If Hell is frozen over, is the only way I would ever eat hear again. Classic, the counter person, Jean,  just came out at 4:07 PM, and sat at the next table and still hasn't  cleaned the tables. Jean needs to be fired.

Nicest, cleanest McDonalds I have ever been to. Staff was so friendly and helpful. My son spilled his milk, and the person who can to clean it up almost seemed excited to be able to help. Even offering several times to get him a new milk. I'll drive across Elk Grove again to come here.

Nice location, now the people around here can drive shorter distances for their big mac and lard filled fries...   It's really clean and modern inside, check it out. It is weird how the restrooms are in the middle of the restaurant, not secluded at all.  The drive thru is really efficient and there's a great plus side. It isn't a secluded drive thru where you have to stay in that line, because it's just a lane that wraps around the back of the building... so if you change your mind and don't feel like getting fat today, you can easily turn out of the lane and get on your way to the gym!  If you don't know what I mean, just give it a try. Drive here, bike here, jogg here, walk here... just don't order calorie massive meals please. I actually had their crispy chicken salad, with balsamic - it was amazeballs for a drive thru salad.
Awesome!!!! Brand new. Killer location. First day open today! Everyone so nice and efficient. So glad for this location.

One car ahead of me today and it took 10 mins. No lie. I live down the street  and come here a couple of other times and took as long or longer. Thus is the last time I come here. I will drive 5 miles to the next one.
This drive thru is a joke! I don't know why I wait 15 minutes just to order and then 10 minutes to get my food. It morning time, they should know people what to be in and out.

Restrooms were clean, but as it was only 9:30am and the kid wanted a meal that came with a toy, no dice.  (Her attempt at ordering was met with the second cruelest word in the English language: "Sorry," but at least didn't accompany the most cruel:  "no.")    Purchase anticipated, but averted as not much on the breakfast menu is toddler compatible.

I was amazed at how well this new location has been performing.  The staff (specifically a young lady with red hair who took our order) was extremely kind.  Rarely do I give reviews to drive-thrus but the staff at this location definitely out-shined other McDonald's (and fast foods) that I have gone to over the past 20 years of my life!  Food-wise, I am always a tester of new flavors that restaurants try to push, so I decided to try the habanero ranch quarter pounder.  Although it isn't as spicy as the name would implies, it was tasty nonetheless.  The deal menu is always a plus and speed of service was blazing fast!  More importantly, McDonald's have come along way in making their menu more friendly to the calorie conscience!  Just wanted to give kudos to where it is deserved!

I hate to be so generous when reviewing a McDonald's, but this one definitely deserves more than 2-stars.    Can't really review the food as, to me, McDonald's food tastes the same at all McDonald's.  So food-wise, this one isn't any different than the McDonald's on Mack Road.    What I'm giving this place 4-stars for is the location and the look.  Starting off with the location, it's nice to finally have a McDonald's nearby that isn't inside a gas station or one that's 15minutes away.  It's right off the freeway and isn't in a busy intersection or a busy shopping plaza.  Really a prime spot to get good business without getting overcrowded.  As far as the look goes, it's really got this super modern look to it.  Doesn't really feel like a McDonald's at all.  Trendy furniture.  Trendy wallpaper.  Trendy layout.  Not to mention there's TVs on the walls that actually show TV shows instead of the McDonald's menu (although they do have TVs as their menu board).    Overall, really glad for a closer McDonald's for those random big mac and nuggets cravings and especially for a McDonald's that actually feels nice to go into.

I go to this location cause it's literally down the street from my house but I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon if at all. Last week I went and got cold fries and water down ice tea it's all I ordered. I figured they were just having a off day. At 130 today I drove through there drive threw. There was only three cars ahead of me and the wait was like if I had twenty cars before me. I had two children in the back seat. I checked my bag off food and grab the happy meal for my son assuming it has everything in it. Shame on me for assuming. Taster a true right there at the window and they were cold like they been sitting for hours nothing worst then Coke McDonald fries then I got home to realIze they didn't put the fires for my son in his happy which mad one very sad two year old. Lucky his mama shared her nasty cold mc Donald fries with him. Then instead of sweet n sour like ask they gave us ranch. Mc Donald's fires are my favorite fast food fire but no more from this location. Very disappointed

The inside is really nice but their customer service is horrible. The wait is ridiculous even though they have a crew of 10 in the back and barely any people. Also the drive thru is always ridiculously long, because they take so long. And one time I was waiting for 20 minutes in the drive thru and I got unsweetened iced tea instead of sweet tea. All that trouble for NOTHING.

McDonald's food is all the same so no point talking about it.  However this place is dirty from the unkempt  tables and the soda fountain area never clean and a sticky floor.  There are hundreds of McDonald's in the area... Avoid this one.

Let me say, I understand its a McDonald's, but I went there to order a Mocha and they forgot the expresso and the chocolate. I arrived at work when I tasted the coffee, so immediately called the McDonalds at my earliest convenience. When I called I let them know, and manager advised the the did not believe me and wanted me to bring the coffee in. I advised he I threw it out, and condescending tone at the time just turned me off. I decided the three bucks is well worth the knowledge of where not to go.

We went here last night around 8 pm to get frappes to find out they were cleaning the machine. They werent serving frappes at the time. We cancelled our whole order thru the drive thru and went to a different location. Very disappointing.

I'm glad they open this location right off of I5 on Elk Grove. This location has always gotten my orders correct as do most McDonalds would always forget something in my bag. The lines here are usually very long at the Drive thru and its usually a pretty long wait. I for one has always been a big fan of the "Big Mac". Who isn't? Add on a large sweet tea and your set to go! Well, not just yet! You must also order your hot crispy delicious McDonald's Fries! =) Now you are set to eat! Enjoy!

This McDonald's sucks! I work close buy, so often times I just want to get s large iced tea. I'm always waiting. I asked my co workers who grab lunch their from time to time and the general consensus is that this location is slow!

Thank you for providing good food thats going to kill me later, as always mcdonalds. This will along with cheap prices will keep me as a faithful customer. The serivice, cleanliness, food, and design are great. However the AC is friggin terrible, its literally like sauna in here. Its nicer outside than it is inside.

Disgusting grilled chicken snack wrap. Not only was it drenched in honey mustard the consistency of the chicken was as if it hadn't been thoroughly cooked. It had this gross crunch to it. I spit it out and threw the whole thing away. Worst $2 I've ever spent.

This morning I was there for breakfast. The guy who took my order sounds like he is fairly new, which it is fine with me. When I approached at the pickup window, I waited for 5 minute w/o any knowledgment from the staff. I saw her was cleaning the coffee station. Finally, she opened the window and asked me what did I ordered. I was pissed! I mean why can she ask when I first arrived at the window. I gave her my receipt w/o a word.   Then few minutes later, she handed over my mocha. I took a sip of it, and it was NOT sweet at all. Then I asked her why my mocha was not sweet, and she said did you ask any flavors to put in it. I said, "no, I just ordered a regular mocha." Then she said, "oh then that is right, so do you want more cream to it?" I was speechless, WTF who put coffee creamer to mocha?!!!!!! I was short on time, so I asked her to give me couple packets of sugar instead.   On top of that, they gave me one harsh brown short. My kids were very up-sad.  I got so mad and tried to call to make a complaint. Here is the best, their phone number was disconnected! WOW!   I wanted to give no star, but Yelp doesn't have that option.

Easily the worst McDonalds in the entire chain. How can it take nearly 15 minutes to get through the drive thru? Ordering inside is just as bad. I have been boycotting this location because they have stolen so much of my time but recently I was asked to go pick up some food from here. Never again. I will drive out of my way to another location and make it home faster than a trip to this piece of garbage location. I don't understand how corporate can let the same owner run this store for as long as he's been able.

Extremely slow every time we go. Also did not even get our order right after waiting for 20 minutes and closed early for "maintenance" and closed even earlier than the time they said they were going to close early at
One star because zero isn't an option! This McDonald's is NOT ALLOWED to do any substitutions! Why would I ever come here again? Simple answer I Won't!
this mcdonalds is trasssssshhhhhh. the best employees have been fired. general manager needs to get fiired instead. veronica is rude disrespectful and lazy.

This place is a work in progress.  It's a really nice location and brand spanking new, but the workers need a bit more experience.  Having to wait 30 min for an order in the restaurant and then have the order incorrect (missing one burger, wrong sauce for the nuggets).   I wasn't the only one too as I saw two folks come in after going through the drive thru and getting incorrect orders.  Give them a few weeks to work out the kinks...
MUCH improved over the location that was on Harbor Point. The fries are always fresh, hot and perfectly salted. The drive-thru seems fast and efficient. No complaints at all!

This store should be ashamed of themselves for treating those adults they way they did.  Incompetent managers, should be fired on the spot.  The store should be shut down.  We in America are so against the discrimination and bullying of so many groups, yet handicapped people are almost the forgotten group.  We all have to meet our maker one day, for this manager, may God have mercy on you...

I'm rating this 3 stars...not because of the food, but because the reason we went there in the first place was to have an indoor play area for our grandkids to have some fun.  To that extent, the visit was a good one. They got to play and have their Chicken McNuggets (that they really like)...Gramma and Papa got the new Bacon Smokehouse Burger.  The burger was definitely not like the great picture they show in their menu or website...it was pretty much just the patty with cheese without a lot of flavor from the "onion strings".  So if you are wanting a real burger, my choice would be Red Robin (or Archie's up by UNR...or even Chili's). But if you have kids and want them to have fun, this isn't a bad place to go.  The staff was polite and the food came out promptly. And it was fairly clean.

How do I rate zero stars?  I realize this is McDonalds and not fine dining however this particular location is the worst I've ever been to. This rating is not based one visit but several over the last eight months. I have never had a good experience at this location.  Posted drive thru hours are until 11:00 pm but if you show up after 9:00 pm it's a crap shoot if their open. When it is open I've never had less then a 10 minute wait. Employees are always rude and there is little to no supervision, in most cases (see below). Check your order before you leave because the odds are good that it's wrong.  Last night was the last and final time I will go to this location. I pulled up to the speaker and waited two minutes to be greeted. This is normal and actually faster then normal. Placed my order with no issues (not normal). Pulled around to find two cars in front of me, paid at the first window and took my place in line. The two cars were served quickly and I'm at the pick up window in the time you'd expect at a McDonalds. 11 minutes later I honk my horn in hopes of getting the attention of the three employees I've been watching screw around with each other and on their phones. One points and laughs as another grabs my bag of food which had apparently been sitting there for a bit, hands it to me and closes the window.  No drink. I knock on the window, she opens it and says what? I didn't get my drink I say. Well we're out of unsweetened tea she says. I guess I just don't get a drink then? I ask for the manager. Window slams shut and a guy shows up who says were out of tea what do you want me to do? How about give me my money back?  He gets another manager for the refund! How can a restaurant that has TWO managers on duty be run this poorly?  The second manager tries to explain that they have difficulty keeping employees. No kidding? With management this bad even teenagers know to get out while they can!

I wish this McDonald's were 24/7, but I realize this is South Reno and very few people want to get McDonald's later than 11 pm or earlier than 6 am. I often get Micky D's for breakfast on special occasion Thursday mornings before work, and the female employee with the Indian accent who works the drive thru in the mornings is THE BEST. She is so pleasant and cheerful that I feel like I am visiting a friend rather than indulging in a guilty pleasure. I always order the same meal, but I always change what size coffee I want and how many creams and sugar substitutes I want. But she always gets it right, and she's super fast at taking my debit card and handing me my order.   Every now and then I'll go in rather than use the drive thru, and this has given me insight into how well the employee who is one or two rungs above the drive thru lady manages the operation. I always see her hustling to help the other employees and helping the show run smoothly.  My experience at this McDonald's is a million times better than my experience at the Vassar location, where everything takes forever, and it's way better than the Keystone McDonald's (my former go-to location, when I lived downtown) because it's not at all shady.

McDonald's on Wedge Parkway had NO tomatoes..,ok you're located in the same shopping center as Raleys.  Went to this location, asked for and charged for extra tomatoes and did not receive.  Also bread was BURNT.  Won't refund any portion unless one drives all the way back.  Waste of time and money but they're sure to get theirs by nickel and dime-ing customers for a slice of tomato.

So this was probably one of the weirdest and worst visits to McDonalds. I was waiting out in the drive through for about 3 minutes without anyone answering. Decided to drive up to the windows just to learn I had to wait another 5 minutes without seeing anyone in the store. One car lined up and indecided to go into the  store. Dead silence. No-one there. Creepy.   Left after 5 minutes or so and drove to south meadows McDonalds. Explained my expirience there but the did not seem to worry about it. Got my food and left.   Just wow.

Went down here around 3:40PM to pick up an UberEats order. Roger, the manager, was zipping around, being efficient and kind to us and everyone around. He was extremely helpful, kind, prompt, and always had a smile. I highly suggest this manager receives a raise of sorts for the energy and enthusiasm he puts into his customer service! Always enjoy picking up to this location due to his excellent service.

Best McDonald's. We love coming here, having chicken nuggets for lunch and letting the kids play in the kid zone when it's too hot to play outside at the park. It's the perfect place to get any size drink for $1, killer deal. It's always clean and you get your food quickly. The French fries are always hot and fresh... have yet to have an experience here where the food tastes like it's been sitting out forever. The only bummer is their ice cream machine goes out of service frequently, and you miss out on delicious Oreo mcflurries or soft serve ice cream cones. Definitely recommend a chocolate dipped cone if you get a chance. I don't have much to say about the staff, they aren't over friendly or eager to help, but they aren't horrible either.

6/29/2018 Hours till 11pm. Crew closed the restaurant at 9:30pm. Won't be back. The associates blocked off the drive through with the car n kept chatting with employees. How can they afford to pay shift managers n not hold them accountable?

This is the dirtiest McDonald's I've experienced in years. The play area is disgusting!!! Not a healthy place to play. And the main dining area was filthy. We were there at 8 am and there were fries still on the floors and in the seats. So obviously they don't clean any time of day. Oh and the eggs were like rubbery bubbly sheets bunched up on the plate. Very strange texture. Horrible place to go all around.

Fade in. Time is 10:45 on a clear midsummer's night, Wednesday June 20th. The lights are on and clearly workers are still home at the establishment set to stay open til 11, as posted.   Me and my friend, Hermanthia, were hankering for some world renown shakes from this establishment. We pull in the drive through, not coned off, and come to a complete stop at the speaker.   We wait a second for an employee to take our order. No sound is heard from the intercom for a good minute or two. We start talking hoping it picks up on the speaker, still no response.   We start greeting the intercom, and yet still no response. Eventually we get fed up, and pull forward to get to the bottom of this travesty. It takes a second for the employee to catch an eye, a rather portly Latino woman mopping the floor without a headset on.   She motions to her neck and points away from the establishment, a motion we did not understand at first. Soon we came to understand that this woman cheated us out of our shakes by closing earlier, a travesty worth capital punishment by corporate. Fade out.

This place is a JOKE ! Posted hours are till 11pm but close at 9pm or earlier on random days. So when the drive-thru person doesn't acknowledge you on the speaker eventually you're smart enough to drive up to the window to get service. You see there are employees visible inside playing on their phones, eating and goofing around. They FINALLY come to the window but say sorry we are closed. How can this be when it states 11pm is when you close. They shut the window and that's the end of that ! Do not support this place !!!!!! We will NEVER and I mean NEVER be back.

Dirty. Dirty. And did I mention dirty??  The entire floor and table  surfaces in the playland... the dining area also. Messy drink lid and napkin area. Ive been to a lot of McDonalds in my life, and this one is just gross.
No one spoke English and got my order completely wrong huge slow moving line probably will see more reviews like this

Drive thru Diet Coke machine is not good. The mix is off. I have told them for over a month. A daily fix for me--now I get out and go inside but at 6am, would rather not. FIX THE MIX--TOO WATERY --PLEASE?

READ THIS BEFORE YOU KEEP SCROLLING THIS IS A GOOD ONE!! So I've had some pretty.. entertaining experiences I've had living in Reno. So one day I went to get a burger with my girlfriend and I swear to you.... THEY PUT CARROTS IN MY BURGER!!!! I Was so hungry and pissed so I took the carrots off and took a big bite and told them that they put carrots on my burger and I want another burger without carrots. THEY SAID NO BECAUSE I STILL ATE SOME OF THE BURGER!! If someone from higher up sees this, please text me I want something for what happened on this crazy umm, lively luncheon. Free food? Sounds fair hmu

Beware of other reviews that give several stars... fake!  There is no supervision for this business, all have a terrible attitude. When you expect quality of their main income driver: food preparation, but get disgusting employees, use caution in deciding this as your meal destination.  Also... They close at 9 pm or earlier on random days. Posted hours are till 11 pm. Even though there were 6 employees visible inside laughing, eating and goofing, they were happy to ignore those that drove up. When they eventually addressed the driver, they were rude and arrogant.

Everytime I go to this place, i keep hoping it would get better and its always a BIG dissappointment...take forever on drive thru and is not very clean. The Burger King inside Walmart is cleaner than this!

I'm going to start this off with a little honesty. The only thing I personally consume at McDonald's are ice cream cones and Diet Cokes.   But, we probably end up here once a week. Why? PLAY PLACE.  We inevitably drive by just about daily and so the kids whine and moan from the backseat about wanting to go.   Is it clean? Nope. Is it sanitary? Not at all. Is there dried up food and grossness everywhere in the play place? MmmHmmm. And I'm totally not above just making sure it's a bath night after being there for an hour or two. The wifi is decent and they often have great deals on the McD app that land us free drinks and the occasional free fry for the kids. Otherwise, we get yogurts and apple slices and a cheap afternoon of playing with kids before going home and burning (I mean washing) our clothes.   I sure wish this place didn't come with the ick factor, but it's so dang close to home that it's hard not to just indulge the kids in the germ-filled place every now and again.

This location over 75% of the time has their milkshake machine broken.  Which is disappointing when you are treating your children to a special drink with their meal.  Now today not only was the machine broken again but they were out of white milk!  Seriously out of milk...

I really do not enjoy McDonalds food. But it was my son's birthday and since we were stuck doing errands in Reno, I wanted a place he could eat and have a play area for him to enjoy. The play area is really big and inside so weather conditions do not matter. The play area is closed off from the rest of the place so kids can be loud without disturbing others without kids. That is really nice.   The first double quarter pounder we got was dried out and tasted horrible. I took one bite and went to the counter and asked for a fresh one to be made. They happily made me another after I explained why I wanted a fresh one. The sweet teas yummy. The fries were fresh the first time around and were not her loaded on salt. For a McDonalds I think this place is great. As a fast food place.......I hate the taste of their food so I guess it was good. My 3 year old enjoyed it.

Came by today to let my daughter burn out some energy while it's hot to play outside. I like the playplace it is separate enclosed area than the rest. Kids can go screaming without disturbing others not in the play area. The food were okay, not great but not bad either. The playplace needs tidying, there are dried up ketchup, crumbs everywhere. I hope they sanitize the playplace everyday. For a lot of kids come and play everyday, the management should look into sanitizing the playplace. I don't mind coming here often if it doesn't have an ick factor.

Worst location in Reno. I bought 2 shakes one evening and they were melted, not full, and with no whipped cream. I called the location, the lady (manager?) had a bad attitude and told me that they would only replace the 2 shakes if they were full. I had to drive all the way back to get the 2 shakes replaced with a different beverage
yet again worst mcdonald's everrrr came in at 9:30 no ones there we waited 5 mins at the drive thru then went to go in and no ones in there this is the worst mcdonald's the posted close time is 11

If you're a Diet Coke aficionado, and too lazy to go inside McD's yourself, you'll recognize the importance of finding a location that delivers consistency. The afternoon drive-thru peeps are the best, they only RARELY mess up my Diet Coke with xTRA ice order, so that gets an A-OK in my book!   The pop syrup generally is in proper ratio with the carbonated water, unlike every other McD's in the area!  Seriously, how hard is it to mess up a pop order?! But I've been betrayed many times at other locations - I've been given regular Coke (horrific!), no ice (unacceptable!), and pop that tastes like bitter acid (stop skimping on the syrup!!!!)  But NOT THIS LOCATION!  The only drawback to the Steamboat McD's? The ick factor of the play place.  The decaying, crusted-on fries, as well as the dull sheen of old fry grease, have taken up permanent residence in the play structure.

I never do Yelp reviews, but had to about this McDonalds.  Somehow they manage to mess up my order EVERY SINGLE TIME.  Today, ordered a double quarter pounder with no onions.  The receipt on the box actually says "no silver onions" and what do you know! ... a healthy helping of onions on my burger.

Four stars for a fast food restaurant? Absolutely!  Wifey had been sick and she always craves french fries when that happens so I was sent on a mission to get said fries. McDonald's is always her choice for the french fries. I only get two items from McDonald's: sweet tea and a hot fudge sundae. My southern body must be replenished frequently with sweet tea and I hate to say it but this is probably the best sweet tea you can get in Reno. Yes, that is sad but I'm just happy to be able to find it here at all. It's one of the things I miss most since moving from the east coast. My second item of choice is alway the hot fudge sundae. It is piled HIGH with that fudge and by high, I mean half of this sundae is just fudge! The ratio of 50% fudge to 50% ice cream is really my favorite.   The service was quick and the employees I dealt with were very personable. They both had smiles on their faces and were pleasant to deal with. I appreciate that! I never set foot inside since I'm a drive-thru kinda girl so I can't comment on the inside of the building. The drive thru was quick, easy, and painless. I left with all the items I came for with a smile on my face.

This place is just awful!  While the establishment itself is relatively new, that's where the appeal ends!  For years now, I've been bringing my kids here to eat and play on their (what used to be relatively clean) "play place."  But over the years, the quality of the food and especially the EMPLOYEES has been alarming!    I mean, I realize that I'm not going to Spago's, so I kind of know what kind of tasteless cheeseburger I'm going to get.  I also know that "turnover" at these fast-food places must be extraordinary, so I also get that keeping "quality" personnel must be next t impossible.   But nearly every visit to this location recently is met with sour, rude, indifferent employees who clearly convey an attitude of not wanting to be there!  I'm sure they probably DON'T want to be working at a McDonald's on a beautiful Sunday afternoon, but today's experience set a new low... even by this establishment's standards!  My sons and I visited today, and we were greeted (?) by "Kayla" at the front counter.  She clearly did not want to be there, and it was very evident by the disgusted and sour look on her face.  My boys and I like our food completely plain (i.e., no sauce or anything else on the burgers), and Kayla appeared irritated at the somewhat confusing order.  Not surprisingly, when we received our order, one of the items was incorrect (it was not plain).  Dreading the confrontation with little Miss Attitude, I walked back out to the counter and explained that one of the burgers had sauce and everything else all over it.  Kayla grabbed the burger, walked back to the cook in the back who glared at me-- as if I had violated some "holy code of returning food" or something, quickly slapped together a correct burger, and slung it across the counter to Kayla.  I said, "thanks, Kayla!"  Silence!  The weekend "manager" here walks around the place with her shirt untucked, and doesn't seem to have a grasp of how this establishment is going.  I'll call the 800 number on the door and see if that gets me anywhere, but bottom line is this:  this place has really gone downhill, and it's primarily because of its employees and management who don't seem to care!

Zero is really my score. This is the worst, rudest, most ridiculous McDonald's I have ever been too. The location causes me to go back!  I have called to complain about having drive-through food thrown at me and the person who I complained to was the supervisor who tossed the food threw the window at me, then closed thw qindow and qalked away. Seriously! She is a supervisor and recently rolled her eyes at a customer with the rude owner right there. He could care less about our happiness... (That last part was supposed to be funny!)
They get make rude faces when you ask for extras sauces. Like they own the damn restaurant. Bad customer service .

This is the worst McDonald's ever! I live in the area so sometimes hit this place in a pinch. It NEVER ends well. Of 15-20 visits over three years, I don't believe they've gotten an order right even once.

I have always liked McDonalds ever since I was a kid.  I also always order the same thing, a quarter pounder with cheese. For me this burger has just the right meat to bun to cheese and condiments.  So the burger I got today was just odd, nothing was right about it. The consistency of the meat was spungy and flavourless. The condiments were barely there and the cheese was no where near melted. I wonder if they actually cook the burgers here or just heat them up. I do know that if this had been the first time eating at McDonalds I would never go back thinking this was the standard.   The bathroom was gross as well, it looked as though it had not been cleaned in days and the waste container was over flowing and we were there at about 10;55 am.  I just know never to come to this store again.

My biggest complaint is the place is FILTHY-they rarely clean it. I've been here several times over the past couple years and it is always the same.  Customers are frequently treated to dirty tables, food, crumbs, and napkins on the floor and under the tables. The ketchup and fountain counter are usually filthy.   I recently witnessed an employee picking up and taking out the trash in the seating area, then was called behind the counter assist. Without washing her hands, she started serving up fries and ice cream cones. Nasty. I will ask them to wash their hands before serving my food.  Customer service has been an real issue with some employees, so training is not consistent. Sometimes they do not greet you,  repeat your order, or even say a word. Very cold and rude.  I like the location, but the filth is unacceptable- managers and employees need to step up their game big time.

Just there today and the guys that takes order from the drive through is very rude! didnt give us straws and spoons for our drinks. He probably hates w9rking there and takes it out on customers! Not okay

They've messed up my breakfast order nearly every time I go through the drive thru! What's up with that!? I usually don't make complaints but I called back on my order was missing its ingredients and the manager was vague on being sorry.? What's up with that also?

Be Warned!  This is the worst McDonalds I have ever been to.  The floors are dirty, employees are undertrained, and there is no leadership at all!!! Waited 15 min for a coffee my friends. The reviews on this place accurately represent what is in store for you.  At the end of a snowy day the play place is this restaurants best feature.

Best McDonald's with a play place in Reno. Pretty good wifi and the regular coffee is pretty good here at the McCafe. All the standard McD's fare. Great place to take your kids on an icy cold day where they can play indoors while you sip hot coffee, cruise the internet and eat mcnuggets for $4.99 a 20 piece (that's just dangerous).

I only felt the need to write a review to offset the one 1-star review that someone left. I've been to hundreds of McDonald's retaurants in my life and I take the kids to this one quite often because it has an indoor playground. As far as McDonald's go, I would put this one in the 95th percentile. It's always as clean as you can reasonably expect and the food is fresh. I'm sure the other reviewer just happened by on a bad day or something. As McDonald's go....this is a good one.

My experience with Mc Donalds in the past was that you can go to one anywhere in the world and it's always the same. Same food, same decor, same standard of cleanliness. While the decor at this particular McD's is nice, the place is filthy. Went with hubby today just to get something to drink. The self-serve drink station was filthy. Straw wrappers everywhere. The little white cups you put ketchup in were wet with old soda. None of the tables were clean. The bathroom wasn't much better. Plus, they seemed to be very short handed. It took about five minutes for the cashier to come and take our order, because she had to fill the previous customer's order all by herself. Didn't look like she had any back up at all. I think I'll skip this one next time.

I come to this mcdonalds every once and a while. I'm a mail carrier so its convenient. Heather is the girl who helps me every single time. She is amazing! Everytime she always ask "is there anything else i can get you?" Which usually dont happen when she isnt around. Ive been there during a horrible lunch rush and she seems to keep her cool with angry customers. Very patient.  McDonald's better keep her around.

If I could give this place no stars I would   Tonight I went in the drive threw and ordered my food at 8:00pm the service was very quick when I was finished paying I was able to drive straight to the pick up window! As I roll up the window is open and I can hear the manager and the other employee helping her "look for my food" the manger realizes that she gave my food to the customer that was in front of me! She quickly starts blaming the other employee saying well she handed me the bag... so on and so forth then when the other employee states I gave u 2 bags I'm sorry u handed out both then manager quickly laughed it off and said I'm sorry I'm tired I only got 5 hours of sleep last night! Continues to complain about no sleep while me and other customers can hear them just talking while everyone is waiting on food!   She then comes and confirms my order to me and then walks over to tell the cook to remake my food! I continue to sit in drive threw for maybe 3 mins when she comes over and "parks me". I drive around the parking lot and park in one of their designated spots! As I sit I see customer after customer leave I even see other cars that were parked waiting for their orders come and go! My son starts crying wanting to get out of the car so I look at my clock and I had been waiting from time of order 18 mins!!!   I get out the car and take my son out of his car seat and have to carry him inside! As I'm walking inside the manager is walking around the counter with a bag so I ask her is that my order she gives me the dirtiest look and says YEA. And swings the bag towards me! My son is upset so I just grab my food and walk out! As I'm walking out another lady is holding the door open for me and states they messed up on ur order I said oh no I just had to wait for mine she continues to tell me that they did not give her her whole order and had to come all the way back for the wrest and when she did that the manager argued with her and then gave her the food in the end!   I get in the car buckle my son up and check my bag!!!!! The whole time I kept telling myself well at least with the wait I will have fresh food!!! Pssshhh yea right not here!! My frys of course were not even full and were cold as if they had been sitting in the bag the entire time not even under the warmers at the very least! The only thing that was warm was the chicken strips that I'm guessing is what took so long in the first place!   I get home take everything out and start serving up our cold food to find out NO NAPKINS AT ALL!!! Not even one!! Like really not only did u mess up u messed up bad!!! No sorry for the wait or here's some apple pies for the wait or maybe even here's some napkins for the chicken strips cuz they are wet and messy (tastes very good btw I would go to another McDonald's for these again)   I used to work at this McDonald's when I was young and worked here for 5 years and continued to work in the food/customer service industry for years and I have never ever given a customer a dirty look or complained about my life in front of them and how I'm tired that's why u have to be inconvenienced and wait for me to get ur food re made cuz I gave it to someone else! Never heard an apology at any point!!! So sad that this is what this McDonald's has become look at the other reviews! They clearly have a management problem and no longer care about customer service!!!

How can this McDonald's look so cool from the outside and be such a disaster on the inside!?!? The manger wasn't friendly at all!!! Almost to the point of being RUDE!!! The food took a while and the employees seemed overwhelmed. They defiantly need some on the job training and customer service trading as well. Which is sad! McDonald's is normally not this bad!!! The sad part is the building itself is retro and very cool looking! Glad I don't live in Lodi! I wouldn't come back to this location!!!   My friend said that behind the counter was a disaster and a total pigsty!!! I didn't see it but I waited in the car. Since we went through the drive-through originally. Then had to wait for our food in front. Not a great experience by any means!!!
They get my order wrong 9 out of 10 times. Name it, they've done it. Horrible training, i imagine.

Today apparently isn't my day for drive through service. Ordered my 2 year old chicken nuggets and fries. They had me pull around and park even though no one else was in the drive through. Waited a ridiculous amount of time. Get home to give my son his food and they didn't give me his fries. Super irritated. Not in the mood to drive back. But seriously sick of this. You made me wait for my order and you still get it wrong. Your job is not that flippin hard.
Every time I come here to the drive thru to order coffee. It's always cold. I always have to come into the store to get another one. This time they just microwaved it. I just threw it away.

This location is right around the corner from my house, so I pop in pretty regularly to grab a soda or a quick bite to eat. There are some occasional hiccups which I find more or less at every fast food location - maybe it takes a little longer than I'd like on a visit or maybe they're out of an item and don't know it until after it's ordered. That said, they're good about correcting it, and the staff is always nice and courteous. They cashiers are always personable and some already have an idea what I might want order to once they see me come in. For me, that, and the proximity to my house, make this a worthwhile stop a couple times a week.

Wow,   I Ordered the new HOT and NOW QUARTER POUNDER...IT WAS COLD AND ROCK HARD EVEN CHEESE!  Both bun slices were solid hard the entire thing was cold to the touch.  All people around me complained about filthy place. I left the place Having never been so disappointed in any McDonald's. I went back the next day for 1 more try I was craving it but even with after manager I spoke with night before taking the order knowing my story got order wrong when I opened the burger was same thing all over o threw it away!  Im staying away they got one star just so I can get this posted I'm still not sure they will. All workers can't remember own names even managers are untrained kids. Need McDonalds school again train them and let them go if don't work.   Video shows how filthy all costumers near me complaining about how dirty it was. June 2018. I ordered thru window first night quarter pounder that is hot & grilled then I kept bugging both girls asking another 3 x's to make sure it's just grilled and hot. Still got one that by code or law should've been thrown out 20 minutes prior. Owner hiring these kids has no pride in this store nor do the employees. Such a shame it used to be my favorite all over the world I've lived & traveled everywhere but this one was my favorite. No more  Tried to post my video will only pictures.   Sorry workers but I call it as I see it. Lodi be warned.  Christine

Absolutely one of the worst McDonald's I have ever been to.  Dirty floors, dirty tables, food all over the ground and filthy counters in the food prep area.   Took over 15 minutes to get one big Mac and it was all out of order when I opened it.   Do not go to this establishment, drive a few extra blocks if you want McDonald's.

Horrible service and lazy staff. Kiosk doesn't even matter as service just sucks! For so many people on the floor and on the clock (talking & standing around) it seems just to difficult to give the right condiments to your guest.

McDonalds is what it is. I was glad they kept the look outside when they opened back up BUT where did all the staff that pretty much knew what they were doing go during the remodel?   I don't mind waiting for the food, especially if I get it fresh. They parked me for over 20 minutes and got mad when I asked them to replace the happy meal I had been given for my son. They served multiple people who had parked next to us before I had to go in and they forgot about us. Then they all blamed someone else. Stuff happens, say sorry and get the order right. Simple as that. There is no excuse for waiting over 20 minutes outside (oh I lie they brought us someone else's order and had to take that back then they forgot about us) and then waiting another 10-15 minutes inside for them to get it together. At that point they threw some pies and cookies in the bag and kept apologizing for each other.   Why do you have to park almost every car every time? I don't understand. Again, fresh is great but having to park car after car is a little ridiculous. They aren't even nice about it. In fact, they aren't nice at all. Maybe because most of them are barely 18 it appears and don't really care about Work.

Wish I could give it 0 worst service here. The remodeled the place and jacked up the prices. My family ordered what we normally order and it's never over 25bucks today it was over 30 WTF . For 30 bucks I could have gotten wingstop! Then we roll up to the window and the person asks if we got any of our food yet. I said no and was asked to go around the corner and park and they'd bring us our food. 15 cars went thru the drive thru while we sat there, one car even pulled up next to us and got their food first. I asked the attendant why I had to wait while 15+ cars went thru. She shrugged and offered no explanation. I told her I wouldn't be back and she walked off yelling an obscenity!! And my food was cold when I got home because we waited so long.  I will never be back, and McDonalds just lost me as a customer.

Made a pit stop on the way to LA... we should have waited, this location is by far the worst location I've been to. We walked in and there was one person in front of us. We were directed to the kiosk. We did not want to use it and were ok with waiting. Another cashier angrily came and took our order. While taking our order, the cashier next to us says loudly "THANK YOU SIR FOR USING THE KIOSK!" Rude. As soon as we paid, our cashier walked away- I even had to reach over and grab my receipt. She did not charge us for two drinks, so I flagged a worker down and began to explain the situation to him... he handed back the receipt and told me to use the kiosk. I decided to talk to the manager, and she didn't care either. Awful service here! What's the point of me using the kiosk? It's not my job to take my own order... that's literally part of YOUR job. Should I go back and cook my order too?
if i could give zero stars i would . service is absolutely horrible . multiple cars could not get their order in and its always been horrible service . ladies are rude .

If I could give negative stars I would. First person at the drive thru and I have to wait for french fries, whatever not a problem. LEFT TO WAIT OUTSIDE WHILE ALL THE OTHERS ARE SERVED FRIES AND LEFT WITHOUT SERVICE INSIDE!! The same guy who told me to wait by the FRONT door, finally asked if we had been helped. FINALLY GAVE US OUR FOOD, WITHOUT SAUCE THAT I REQUESTED!! This has to be a joke!! Brand new look and everything, yet non of the workers can do their jobs. OH BY THE WAY GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!! I'll drive out of my way for another McDonalds cause this place, plus the rude manager sucks big time.

This mcdonalds is literally the worst.  I dont know how workers like these can "demand $15/hour" when all they do is ask you if you want to use the kiosk to place your order. We had a question about the menu so we said no wed like to order at the counter. The mid said "ok well I'll be right back" and walked away.  Meanwhile another worker said "you can use the kiosk" and we said no, we are waiting for the guy that said hed be right back. Finally he comes back.  We order two large cokes and a large fries.  They gave us our receipt with a number on it, and said to watch the screen for our number. We waited 17 minutes and our number never came. Finally we went back to the counter and were like what's the hold up on one large fries? The counter help didnt know, but somehow wrangled us our fries.  On aside note, I used the bathroom while we waited and it was DISGUSTING. LITERALLY SH*T all over the toilet seat of the one stall that was working. The other stall was locked with no sign indicating it was out of order but nobody was inside.  The stall I could use, not only was covered in poop, but there were no seat covers and the giant 12" roll of toilet paper was just sitting sideways on the tampon trash container, not in the tp holder.  Never again, will I return to this actual sh*thole.

I'm giving a star for cleanliness. That's the only positive I could think of.  I wanted a McGriddle on my last visit. Clearly, on the menu board under the heading of All Day Breakfast is the McGriddle. When I ordered it, the guy behind the counter looked at me like I had 2 heads. "That's a breakfast item. We're not serving breakfast now."  When I pointed it out on the menu board, he went to the back to ask someone else. "No, we don't serve those all day." No friendly service, broken milkshake machines, half-filled sundae cups, these are things you should expect when visiting this McDonald's. Also, don't expect to be able to order from the menu board.

terrible service. the workers always seem like they are mad or angry. The last time I came one of the workers was crying and just today the cashier told me that i couldn't use my card because the machine was down and its been down for almost 2 weeks.

I was very disappointed after the place was closed for remodeling. It's open again. At 4:00 I'm not a clean table to choose from. I had to wipe my own table with hand cloths. The staff was sitting around eating. One that took my order was later sweeping and emptying garbage. It so ignorant not to teach hygiene. No gloves. I wonder how many get sick there. The one employee knew I had trouble finding a clean table but ignored me and kept eating. Poor customer service. Poor hygiene. I think it's up to the manager to watch this stuff. I won't return to a filthy place like that. I'm afraid my grandson will be ill. Bus and clean own tables when it was pretty vacant. Educate everyone more.

Cool looking McDonald's that's for sure. I drove into the drive-thru and I was the only car. I ordered 3 McChickens, a McDouble, and 3 Apple Pies for my family and I. Even though I was the only car in the Drive-thru, I was in the car for 10 minutes, which is awfully long for Drive-Thru fast food. Food was a-ok, it's McDonald's what else can you expect?

Avoid the busy times. I went for a few McDoubles early this morning, and it was packed. My food wasn't the best-looking, and I felt sick soon after.   Some of the tables hadn't been bussed, but that I can forgive as I came in during a peak time.
Horrible service. They always move so slow. I understand that it's a fast food place and you'll have to wait but I just watched them send 4 cars to the wait area. They have very untrained staff.

this is by far the worst in customer service cause there is none. the workers avoid you like the plague. they see you but dont want to work. they wont come to front counter and try to get you to use kioske yet if its cash they still need to come to counter. they are all lazy. it took 10 minutes to get service and the guy working driveout in am thinks its funny. he sees you out the corner of his eye but just grins like its a joke. they need to spend money on rebuilding the workers and less on looks of building. i would fire every last one this morning that wasc on shift
Terrible attitude from the girl handing out the food in the driveway!
This place is so sick. The staff is so nice. My fries are always good when i come here. I love the doller menu

My first time here tonight, I came with my family.   We just got back from the Farmers market a block away and needed a drink.   First thing that stood out is this is an old style McDonald's on the outside. Pretty cool, in my opinion. On the inside is up to date and pretty clean.   The front register girl Samantha was excellent. Service with a smile and she stays smiling. All we ordered was ice tea, Iced coffee and water. There was a lot of people coming and going.   What I liked was  crew member Tara running around and keeping the place clean. I didn't eat any food only got drinks. Next time I'm in town, I'll stop by again.  Vincent D. *VD* Life is Beautiful

I go here once a few months and everytime I'm utterly disappointed. I do live a block away and just want a plain cheese burger (nothing special) so I'll drive over. It never fails to be a bad choose since my order is always wrong.   Whet tonight and my order was wrong as usual, but to boot, when I was handed my ice tea the gentlemen asked me if I wanted a straw?! Humm....no, I'll just stick my tongue in the hole. Sheesh. At least I got a laugh.

disgusting, went in late at night floors were filthy trash cans overflowing and heard an employee talking to the night manager about their mcflurry machine being dirty and the manager just told her to be quiet and just make the orders they had. would give zero if possible. very disappointed.

This location is close to my girlfriends house and the look of it is different than any other McDonald's I've ever seen! It's s classic look which is really cool! We ordered and the lady taking our order was very nice she entered what we wanted differently in a way that it would come out cheaper what was awesome and our food was quick the fries were hot and crispy! Overall it was a good meal

Never had my order be right! We always order cheeseburger, no cheese. And when we get it, it always has cheese and then I have to argue with them because they always try and tell me that they gave me the correct thing. Obviously not.   Also had the girl tell me she couldn't break my $100 bill, had to ask her to get the manager to get change for it. I shouldn't have to have asked. It just should have been done. Employee here are lazy. Also, It's tiring to have all the homeless outside asking for everything. 2, 3, 4 homeless men in the drive through, waiting for you at the door, etc. Why is protecting patrons never a priority to these large corporations?
Dining area is nice and clean, bathroom is filthy though...:(  I usually get the jalapeno double which has a nice kick and taste to it.
Always bad customer service. I hate going there but like McDonald's. Just need to find a different one to go to.
If you enjoy hot fresh fries and tasty mc chicken sandwiches stop here. Overall clean restaurant with clean restrooms and friendly service.

I come here every once and a while.  The staff is really friendly, but they never ever get my order correct or complete, i either have someone elses food or part of my order is missing which is sad because i don't even order much food.  I thought i would stop by today for the breakfast #4 and go figure i drive away hashbrowns are missing. I don't yelp often but i feel like something has to be said because I know i personally will never go back here again, they just make too many mistakes.

I went through the drive-thru this afternoon to grab an after school snack for my kids. Everything was great until we got to the window to pick up our order. First let me say that the girl (Adrianna I believe her name was) was extremely nice and professional. She handed us our drinks and went to hand us our order of two fries and got a little confused. This was totally understandable since there was a huge line in the drive-thru and there were about 3-4 bags/orders on the counter next to her. She confirmed what my order was to ensure she gave me the correct bag, but as it turned out, she didn't have our bag so she asked the manager. The manager yelled at her, saying "I gave you that order. What did you do with it if it's not right in front of you?!" Mind you, this manager was at least 5 feet away from the drive-thru window and my kids and I were able to hear her yell at this poor girl loud and clear. I felt so bad for this girl and all she kept doing was apologizing to me. The manager went and got our order, again, just an order of two medium fries and tossed it on the counter at this girl while still talking down to her. I asked for the managers name as well as her own name and told her that I'd be making a complaint about that. Nobody should be treated that way. That poor girl was trying her best and handled that highly embarrassing situation far better than many people would have. The manager's name is Sam (I suspect short for Samantha) and is the worst example for what employees should strive to be. I do appreciate the lesson she gave to my 8 and 10 year old boys as to how NOT to treat people. To top it off, I got home and took the fries out of the bag and what we got was basically small fries in a medium container.  We also got ripped off if that matters. I fully intend to make a formal complaint to the franchise owner and to the McDonald's corporate offices.
Sam the store manager is very rude. All I can hear is her yelling at the employees while I'm eating my food. Also the lobby is always dirty.

I'm giving this place one star because we found a large piece of plastic in my daughter's hamburger. We were told it was part of the plastic wrapping from the cheese block (the manager showed us). My daughter is traumatized and refuses to eat hamburgers now. At least they refunded my money and apologized.

A bunch of inbreds work here. Every single time I come here they mess up my order. How hard is it to not add pickles? Or better yet to put everything I ordered in the bag not just half the stuff. And I'm pretty sure it doesn't take 20mins to give me my stuff it's not like it's a 5 star restaurant were the food takes longer to cook. I guess they are too busy chatting to each other.

McDonalds is good,but when I go through the drive through I order ice cream. Then I say chocolate covered and most of the time they ignored me. And even sometimes they don't even give me the ice cream. Or whenever I get anything else they don't do it corectly.
Very slow service!!!!!! Need to hire more workers!!!!
Best McDonald's in Lodi. Fresh food. Clean restaurant. Great staff.
cool old skool.. but the wait is at least 15 minutes every fricken time.   so expect extra time.  morons...

Aw! Why not? There's a special 2 Big Mac's for $4... that's a pretty good reason to try McDonald's today. Two national fast food chains in a row... must be a trend.  If I had my druthers (and since the kids are grown) I'd frequent Jack in the Box or Carl's Jr over McDonald's anyday. But since there's a sale on Big Mac's... might as well sit down and do a review...  Big Mac's - they just get smaller and smaller and smaller every time I frequent McDonald's! (**)  Fries - the worst fries of any national fast food chain... fried to a crisp... excessive amounts of salt (*) National chain with worst fries than McDonald's: In 'N Out.  Coffee - I've read that to some people McDonald's Coffee is better than Starbuck's. Amazing, but true! I wouldn't go to Starbuck's, mainly because the price is so high. But McDonald's is just selling plain brewed Coffee, folks! That's all it is! If you want this Coffee, stay home and just add an extra couple spoonfuls of Coffee in your coffee maker. What I didn't like about my Coffee order - the cashier asked me how many sugars and creams I wanted in my coffee - I said three of each. Instead of leaving packs of sugar and vials of cream on my plate... McDonald's actually mixed it for me. That saves money for McDonald's in terms of waste... but what if I change my mind? (***) Can't give their Coffee more than 3 stars because I make just as good Coffee by staying HOME!

It's your standard McD's. The service is fast and the staff is friendly. The place is clean enough, although the last time I was there the restrooms were iffy. I go there when it's convenient. Nothin good or bad to say.
Come meet Speedee, the official McDonalds character from 1953 to 1962.
Best service. The app made a mistake and we couldn't get what we wanted. The crews here helped take care of it. Five stars for the service and food - Big Mac and fries taste so fresh!

Stoped by last night after a long flight from New York and ordered some regular cheese burgers and a large fry in the drive thru. The line was long so I would guess that everything  being made was fresh and HOT. After receiving my order that was sitting on the counter by the drive thru window for about 4 minutes I drove off to my home. I live literally 4 minutes away! I opened the bag and to my surprise everything was ice cold in the bag! The frys were just plain nasty and the burgers weren't much better!!!!! I'm certain that I won't go back to that store again ............
Went through the drive through, saw a crazy thicc squirrel doing karate with a plastic spoon. Hella tight entertainment while waiting for my fudge sundae. McDonald's knows what they're doing.

So as most of us we have been to a McDonald's. But it's almost 11am and i wanted a hash brown and the manager said she would cook me a hash brown if I wanted one. I was so very happy about it. Only downside to this location is that it's inside Walmart!
